1% function [ w ] = Mtransp_times_b( M, b )
 2% [nFibers] = size(M.Phi,1);
 3% [nTheta]  = size(M.DictSig,1);
 4% [nAtoms] = size(M.Phi,2);
 5% [Nvoxels] = size(M.Phi,3);
 6% 
 7% w = M.DictSig'*reshape(b,[nTheta,Nvoxels]); % This is still a little bit 
 8% % memory expensive because w is a (Nd x Nvoxels) matrix (Nd = # atoms)
 9% % See comments below for a very memory efficient implementation but very
10% % slow without using a compiled version (MEX).
11% M.Phi = reshape(M.Phi,[nFibers,nAtoms*Nvoxels]);
12% w = double(ttv(M.Phi,w(:),2));
13% end
14
15%%
16% The following is a memory efficient version that should be compiled in
17% order to provide fast results
18
19function [ w ] = Mtransp_times_b(atoms,voxels,fibers,values,D,Y,nFibers)
20w = zeros(nFibers,1);
21for k = 1:length(values)
22    %k
23    w(fibers(k)) = w(fibers(k)) + (D(:,atoms(k)))'*Y(:,voxels(k))*values(k);
24end
25
26% 
27% for f=1:Nf
28%     for l=1:Nelem(f)
29%         w(f) = w(f) + (D(:,atoms(f,l)))'*Y(:,voxels(f,l))*S0(voxels(f,l));
30%     end
31% end
32
33
34% [nFibers] = size(M.Phi,1);
35% [nTheta]  = size(M.DictSig,1);
36% [Nvoxels] = size(M.Phi,3);
37% 
38% b = reshape(b,[nTheta,Nvoxels]); % matrix reshape
39% 
40% w = zeros(nFibers,1); % output
41% 
42% for f=1:nFibers
43%     f
44%     A = sptenmat(M.Phi(f,:,:),1); % ->sptenmat
45%     aux = sum(b(:,A.subs(:,2)).*M.DictSig(:,A.subs(:,1)),1);
46%     w(f) = sum(aux'.*A.vals(:));
47% end
48% 
49% 
50% end
51
